content.title: iPhone 13 mini
content.description: A great compromise between size and performance. Might change it this year

content.title: iPad Pro 11" M1
content.description: The best iPad I ever had (started with an iPad 2 then an Air 2). Powerful, light, and the pencil is a game changer

content.title: Apple Watch Ultra
content.description: Upgraded from a Series 3. I think it's the greatest bang for the bucks when it comes to smart watches

content.title: Airpods (Gen 1)
content.description: Their 5 year old batteries are starting to show signs of fatigue but they're still great. I used to buy a pair of earbuds a year minimum. I haven't bought any in 5 years.

content.title: Steelseries Arctis 3
content.description: This is the best headset I ever had and I keep recommending that line of product. The ski band is a game changer and the earmuff fabric is the best I've ever seen

content.title: MacBook Air M1 13" 2021
content.description: Powerful, silent, and light—what more can you ask?

content.title: HP Z27 monitor
content.description: I absolutely love this monitor and the quality of the image. I think 27" is the perfect compromise of size. My only complaint is about the startup time

content.title: Elgato Stream Deck
content.description: Fun lil gadget to control Zoom and A/V setup

content.title: Elgato Wave 3
content.description: This mic has a great sound quality and works over USB-C. Really worth it if you're on Zoom or recording voice a lot

content.title: Elgato Facecam
content.description: It's _okay_ but I wouldn't miss it if I didn't have it tomorrow

content.title: Apple Keyboard 2014
content.description: A good ol' keyboard—powered by AA batteries!

content.title: Magic Trackpad
content.description: I can't go back to mouse

content.title: Tresanti Standing Desk
content.description: I didn't get the hype around standing desk. Got one. Changed the height a lot for a few weeks. haven't moved it a lot since

content.title: iMac 27" 2017
content.description: I upgraded to a 5K iMac when my 2011 MBP died. It's a 6 year old computer but still feels extremely fast and fresh

content.title: Asus 19"
content.description: It's an old LED screen that I have for about 10 years now. It's not as great as it was but it does the trick

content.title: Lacie HDD
content.description: I'm a Lacie fan and have multiple HDDs running for almost 10 years without a hiccup

content.title: Firefox
content.description: Die-hard fan since 2004.

content.title: 1Password
content.description: If you're not using a password manager yet, 1Password is a great option (albeit their UX and app quality are on a downhill slope

content.title: Backblaze
content.description: Backblaze brings me utter peace of mind by doing unlimited offsite backups. 100% worth it

content.title: VSCode
content.description: I was LTTP and moved from Atom but haven't looked back once

content.title: Starship
content.description: This makes my Terminal much fancier and easier to use

content.title: Canon EOS 6D
content.description: This is my workhorse DSLR and my first pro camera. It still shoots great and the images are still amazing

content.title: Olympus OMD M10 Mk II
content.description: I was looking for a smaller digital camera to carry around and got the Olympus as I believed the M4/3 would be a better option in the long run. I wasn't right.

content.title: Olympus E-PL1 (Infrared)
content.description: I bought this second hand camera and gutted it to turn it into an infrared camera

content.title: DJI Mavic Air 2
content.description: I don't fly drones as much as I used to but it's a great flying camera

content.title: DJI Phantom 3 Pro
content.description: My original drone back from 2015. It's an absolute tank and the images are still amazing

content.title: DJI Action 3
content.description: My GoPro Hero 3 Black not being what it used to be, and looking for an action cam for fun, I got an Action

content.title: Mamiya RB 67
content.description: I restored this fully mechanical medium format camera (light sealing, leather pieces, etc... and love the quality of the images (don't love the 2 tons weight though)

content.title: Intreprid 4x5 Mk IV
content.description: After trying to build a Standard Camera from 3D printed parts and running into many issues, I bit the bullet and got the Intrepid. I should have done that from the start

content.title: Olympus M10
content.description: This is a camera from my Mom and I love how nifty it is

content.title: Canon EOS 650
content.description: Got this as a free add-on after buying a second-hand lens

content.title: Xbox Series X
content.description: It's not as mind-blowing as I thought it'd be but the loading speed, 120fps, and 4K HDR are pretty amazing

content.title: Oculus Quest 2
content.description: Got this from work and after a 1-year frenzy, I haven't used it a lot lately

content.title: iPad M1 11" EFB
content.description: I got a second iPad as my Electronic Flight Bag so I didn't have to bring my main one on flights in the off chance it'd be damaged

content.title: David Clark H10 13.4
content.description: Started with a mid-range headset which I find pretty good. Might upgrade to ANR at some point and keep this one for passengers
